dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 4532 IH: American Cooperation with Our Neighbors Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Stanton (for himself and Mr. Kean) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of State to develop a strategy on efforts to strengthen subnational cooperation between the United States and Mexico, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the American Cooperation with Our Neighbors Act.

subsection.text: Not later than 270 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of State, in coordination with the Administrator of the United States Agency for International Development, shall submit to the Committee on Foreign Affairs of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Foreign Relations of the Senate a strategy on efforts to strengthen subnational cooperation between the United States and Mexico for the purposes of—

paragraph.text: enhancing law enforcement cooperation and local, State, and Federal security forces cooperation at a subnational level for the purpose of curbing fentanyl trafficking and other synthetic opioids, including activities such as—

subparagraph.text: bolstering technical assistance and coordination for law enforcement agencies and local, State, and Federal security forces;
carrying out exchange programs for the purposes of professional development; and

paragraph.text: bolstering subnational dialogue and capacity building between Federal and local governments, civil society, faith-based organizations, and business community leaders and integrating issues faced by local communities, including with respect to trafficking of fentanyl and other synthetic opioids; and
strengthening capacity building and provide resources for border towns and organizations within those towns that attempt to meet the needs of communities.

subsection.text: Not later than 2 years after the date of the submission of the strategy under subsection (a), the President shall submit to the congressional committees specified in subsection (a) an update containing an assessment of the implementation and effectiveness of the strategy, lessons learned from the past year with respect to the strategy, and planned changes to the strategy.
The strategy under subsection (a), and the update under subsection (b), shall be submitted in unclassified form.

paragraph.text: The Secretary of State may not carry out any project, program, or activity that implements the strategy under subsection (a) for the purpose specified in paragraph (1)(C) of such subsection until the Secretary submits to the appropriate congressional committees a notification regarding the data intended to be shared with foreign countries pursuant to such strategy.
In this subsection, the term appropriate congressional committees means—

subparagraph.text: the Committee on the Judiciary, the Committee on Homeland Security, the Committee on Foreign Affairs, and the Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on the Judiciary, the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs, the Committee on Foreign Relations, and the Select Committee on Intelligence of the Senate.

section.header: Department of State review of access to finance in CARICOM member states

subsection.text: The Secretary of State, in consultation with the Secretary of Treasury, shall conduct a review to determine any steps, balancing costs and benefits, that the Secretaries could take to expand financial access to the member states of the Caribbean Community (CARICOM), including through a review of—

paragraph.text: enforcement of international laws and compliance standards;
reporting requirements pertaining to narcotics trafficking and illicit finance thereof;
possible expansion of embassies and consulates in the region; and
programming or lack thereof pertaining to access to capital in the region.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall submit to the appropriate congressional committees a report on the findings of the Secretary pertaining to the review under subsection (a).
In this section, the term appropriate congressional committees means—

paragraph.text: the Committee on Foreign Affairs and the Committee on Financial Services of the House of Representatives; and
the Committee on Foreign Relations and the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs of the Senate.
